channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gen Z is splurging on $325 AmEx Gold cards to snap up redeemable restaurant credits
item.description: The card’s Resy partnership has drawn in an outsize flood of young spenders.

item.title: Can the Justice Department Survive a Trump Wrecking Ball?
item.description: Over the next four years, the rule of law will face a profound test.

item.title: Why gold is breaking records—and where it could go next
item.description: If trends continue, analysts have bullish outlooks on the price of gold for the months ahead.

item.title: Biden Administration Ignites Firestorm With Rules Governing A.I.’s Global Spread
item.description: The tech industry is fighting new regulations, expected soon, that aim to keep the cutting-edge technology in the United States and allied countries.

item.title: All the Hollywood stars who have lost their homes or had to evacuate due to the California wildfires
item.description: Paris Hilton, Billy Crystal, and James Woods all lost their homes.

item.title: Who Is Pierre Poilievre, the Conservative Leader on a Path to Become Canada’s Next Prime Minister?
item.description: Pierre Poilievre, the Conservative leader, enjoys a commanding lead in the polls as Canadians look to the next general election.

item.title: Two misuses of popular AI tools spark the question: When do we blame the tools?

item.title: Lebanese Lawmakers Choose a President After 2 Years of Gridlock
item.description: As the country endured economic crisis and a devastating war, lawmakers failed 12 times to pick a head of state. They have now settled on Joseph Aoun,...

item.title: It Is Tearing Me Up Not to Be in L.A. Right Now
item.description: Los Angeles may have a reputation for being superficial, but it is in fact a territory that might, at any moment, upend (or even end) your life.

item.title: The Los Angeles wildfires are upending life for the city’s workers. What bosses need to know
item.description: “Let people leave. That's the first thing.”

item.title: Boarding Schools: China’s Tool to Assimilate Tibetan Children
item.description: The Chinese government is placing hundreds of thousands of Tibetan children in boarding schools, as a way to mold them into citizens loyal to Beijing....

item.title: N.Y. Prosecutors Urge Supreme Court to Let Trump’s Sentencing Proceed
item.description: The Supreme Court is now set to decide whether Donald J. Trump’s sentencing on 34 felony counts should proceed on Friday as planned.

item.title: U.S. Saw an Opportunity While It Pushed to Arm Ukraine
item.description: The White House seized a rare chance to undermine Russia and build up regional allies as it built a coalition to support the Ukrainians.
